block.p: Amanda Wren Bergen, a daughter of Carolyn and Bruce Bergen of Kennebunk, Me., was married yesterday to Gian-Carlo A. Peressutti, the son of Patricia and Italo Peressutti of New York. The Rev. Carolyn Lambert, a Congregational minister, officiated, and the Rev. Vernon Decoteau, a Roman Catholic priest, took part in the ceremony at the South Congregational Church in Kennebunkport, Me.

Mrs. Peresutti, 26, was until May a reporter for KRIV-TV in Houston. She graduated from Wellesley College. Her father is the senior partner in Berger & Parkinson, a law firm in Kennebunk. Her mother is a social worker for the York County Probate Court in Alfred, Me.

Amanda Wren Bergen, a daughter of Carolyn and Bruce Bergen of Kennebunk, Me., was married yesterday to Gian-Carlo A. Peressutti, the son of Patricia and Italo Peressutti of New York. The Rev. Carolyn Lambert, a Congregational minister, officiated, and the Rev. Vernon Decoteau, a Roman Catholic priest, took part in the ceremony at the South Congregational Church in Kennebunkport, Me.

Mrs. Peresutti, 26, was until May a reporter for KRIV-TV in Houston. She graduated from Wellesley College. Her father is the senior partner in Berger & Parkinson, a law firm in Kennebunk. Her mother is a social worker for the York County Probate Court in Alfred, Me.

Mr. Peresutti, 27, is the press secretary for former President George Bush. He graduated from Georgetown University. His father is a maitre d'hotel at the Four Seasons restaurant in New York. The bridegroom's mother is a counselor with Windham International, an executive relocation firm, and a substitute teacher at St. David's School, both in New York.
The couple met in 1998 when the bride, then working for WGME-TV in Portland, Me., covered a golf tournament in Kennebunkport in which the former president was playing.
